summary: The Strengthening Child Exploitation Enforcement Act (S. 1333) amends Title 18 of the United States Code to modify provisions related to kidnapping, sexual abuse, and illicit sexual conduct involving minors. Key changes include modifying kidnapping definitions, amending penalties for abusive sexual contact, creating a new offense for intentional touching of a minor's genitalia, and establishing a defense concerning the victim's age in certain cases. The bill aims to strengthen protections for children against sexual exploitation and related offenses.
